com.xtructure.xevolution.genetics.impl
Class AbstractPopulation<D>

java.lang.Object
  com.xtructure.xutil.id.AbstractXIdObject
      com.xtructure.xevolution.genetics.impl.AbstractGeneticsObject
          com.xtructure.xevolution.genetics.impl.AbstractPopulation<D>
Type Parameters:
D - type of data used in Genomes
All Implemented Interfaces:
EvolutionObject, GeneticsObject, Population<D>, XIdObject, java.lang.Comparable<XIdObject>, java.lang.Iterable<Genome<D>>, java.util.Collection<Genome<D>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractNEATPopulation, PopulationImpl
public abstract class AbstractPopulation<D>
extends AbstractGeneticsObject
implements Population<D>

AbstractPopulation implements the getters for the Population interface and the Collection methods. It also includes the functionality for removing dead genomes, writing the population to a file, and refreshing the Population's statistics. The statistics maintained include the genomes with the highest or lowest value of any genome (number) attribute present, the highest or lowest ever such genomes (which may or may not belong to the current population), and the average of those attributes from among those genomes currently in the population.

The implementation of validate ensures that the statistics lowest/highest genome statistics point to genomes currently present in the population, and that the population keys genomes by their own id.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda
